intro: Achasma australasica, commonly known as the New Zealand broom, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and forested areas, often in sandy or rocky soils. It is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. However, it is also considered an invasive species in some regions outside its native range.
